title: 3rd Meetup: Intro to dplyr & Github
description:
Our preliminary schedule for the meeting:
15:00 Reception
15:10 Workshop 1: Intro to dplyr by Paloma (co-organizer)
15:45 Coffee&Tea break
16:00 Workshop 2: Intro to Github by Elena (co-organizer)

Please bring your laptops fully charged in order to be able to follow the workshop. We have limited number of sockets in the meeting room. Internet WiFi connection is very good!
If possible have R/Rstudio already installed on your laptops.
(you can download R at the following link -> https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/
and RStudio from here -> https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/ )

Hope you will join us to celebrate the first year of R-Ladies Rotterdam together!

title: R-Ladies Drinks **also for ladies who don't know R**
description:
Join the social drink with the R-Ladies!

Let’s have a casual drink in between workshops, where we can socialize, get to know each other better and have a fun night.
Join us to:
- cbind(you, R-ladies community)
- if(glass[‘volume’] == 0) print(“One more beer please!”)
- Just have a drink and have some fun!

title: 2nd Meetup: Interactive data visualization with rBokeh package
description:
After a long break since our first meetup in spring, we are coming back to refresh our connections and R knowledge!

Our preliminary schedule for the meeting:
- Reception at 3pm
- Introductory presentation
- Workshop: Interactive data visualization with rBokeh package by Elena (co-organizer)
- Coffee&Tea break
- 5 x Lightning talks (5 x 15 minutes - by members on any R-related topics)
- Coffee&Tea break
- Wrap-up & networking

We kindly invite you to send us a message/e-mail if you would like to give a lightning talk to discuss further! It can be any topic related to R: research, problems and solutions when working in R, tips&tricks, you name it!

Please bring your laptops fully charged in order to be able to follow the workshop. We have limited number of sockets in the meeting room. Internet WiFi connection is very good!
If possible have R/Rstudio already installed on your laptops.
(you can download R at the following link -> https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/
and RStudio from here -> https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/ )

Join us for the 2nd Meetup this year!

title: First meetup of the R-Ladies Rotterdam
description:
We are thrilled to announce the first meetup of R-Ladies Rotterdam!

Our preliminary schedule for the meeting is the following:
- Reception at 12 pm at Erasmus MC (from 12.00 - 12.30pm)
- Introductory presentation of the R-Ladies community by Ingrid - organizer RladiesRdam
(from 12.30 - 12.45 )
- Workshop: Using R for my Research (modern uses: Markdown & Shiny apps) by Elrozy
(from 12.45- 14.15)
- Coffee&Tea break (from 14.15 - 14.30 )
- Demonstration: How to use blogdown - Create Blogs and Websites with R Markdown by Brett -
co-organizer (from 14.30 - 15.00 )
- Coffee&Tea break (from 15.00 - 15.15 )
- Discussion about the meeting and ideas for future meetups - get feedback from the participants and presenters (from 15.15 - 15.45)
- We will end the meeting with drinks and something sweet to celebrate (max. until 17.00 hours)

NOTE! Please bring your laptops fully charged in order to be able to follow the workshop. We have limited number of sockets in the meeting room. Internet WiFi connection is very good!
If possible have R/Rstudio already installed on your laptops.
(you can download R at the following link -> https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/
and RStudio from here -> https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/ )

Looking forward to meeting you all!

title: R-Ladies Social Drinks
description:
It's time for another R-Ladies social drinks!

If you don't know us yet, this is the perfect time to get to know the community in an informal setting and learn about who we are and what we do. If you do already know us, then you don't need a reason for grabbing some drinks ;).

title: How diversely do we read?  Web scrapping in R
description:
In this workshop, we will provide an introduction to web scraping in R using the package {rvest}.

We'll go through some examples together, learning the basic structure of webpages and exploring different ways to extract data from a website.

The workshop is intended to be fun, and we'll be web scraping and web querying data about books and their authors to answer the question of how diversely do we read. Therefore it doesn't matter if you are a beginner or if you are an R expert, this workshop is for everyone!

Looking forward to see you!

######
For this workshop please bring your laptop with R and Rstudio installed.

We will be using the following packages: tidyverse and rvest.

Link to presentation: To be updated.

Link to files for the workshop: To be updated

####Preliminary program:

18:00 - 18:15 Welcome and setup

18:15 - 19:00 Workshop part 1.

19:00 - 19.15 Break.

19: 15 - 20:00 Workshop part 2.

20:00 - 21:00 Closure and socializing

####
This event is free of cost.

##################
Presentation and materials can be downloaded from: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1dwkzye9CTcoG_T-cIUJS9enVLeFjKtCY

Or from our github repo:
https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_rotterdam

##################

title: Work happieR: A workshop on project oriented workflow in R
description:
Are you familiar with problems setting the working directory?

Did you ever had to re-run your code to produce results or graphs?

Do you ever have to work with both data, a script and a report?

Did you ever opened your own work and got lost in your own files?

Do you want to make your code, research or product useful for others? Or for future self?

If your answer is yes to any of the questions above, this workshop is for you! You will learn how to maximize effectiveness, reduce frustration, facilitate collaboration and increase readability of your work.

Doesn't matter if you are a beginner or if you are an R expert, this workshop is for everyone!

######
For this workshop please bring your laptop with R and Rstudio installed.

Link to presentation:

https://rladies-rdam-workhappier.netlify.com/

Link to files for the workshop:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Hpxg0dfFLki7AqTXOdFLBgNdnmw9bQDt?usp=sharing

####Preliminary program:

18:00 - 18:15 Welcome and setup

18:15 - 19:00 Workshop part 1.

19:00 - 19.15 Break.

19: 15 - 20:00 Workshop part 2.

20:00 - 21:00 Closure and socializing

####

This event is free and will be hosted by 42workspace (https://www.42workspace.com/), the leading tech co-working hub of Rotterdam, located in the beating heart of the city, so save your spot now!

Looking forward to see you!

###

title: Get to know R-Ladies | Social Drinks
description:
It's time for another R-Ladies social drinks!

If you don't know us yet, this is the perfect time to get to know the community in an informal setting and learn about who we are and what we do. If you do already know us, then you don't need a reason for grabbing some drinks ;).

title: The tidyverse special edition. Workshop.
description:
Welcome!

We are starting this season with a workshop to boost your skills in R!

We will go through the essentials of the tidyverse packages, covering functions that will help you transform and clean a raw dataset to packages that will help you communicate your results with beautiful graphs and tables!

Doesn't matter if you are a beginner or if you are an R expert, this workshop is for everyone!

For this workshop please bring your laptop with R and Rstudio installed.
We will use the following packages: tidyverse and kableExtra.
Scrips and presentation will be announced and provided before the meetup in the following link: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_rotterdam.

####Preliminary program:

18:00 - 18:15 Welcome and setup

18:15 - 19:00 Workshop part 1.

19:00 - 19.15 Break.

19: 15 - 20:00 Workshop part 2.

20:00 - 20:30 Closure and socializing

####

Looking forward to see you!

The materials are available in this https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1LkHdk3LxTVM_JALHNBlOJBLSC_9FW-J-

title: Youth Tech Fest where Girls innovate
description:
Youth Tech Fest where Girls innovate' for International Women's Day 2019 for girls between 11 and 18 years old @CODAM Amsterdam. Sign up for 'Youth Tech Fest where Girls innovate':

http://bit.ly/YouthTechFestGirls2019

Meld je nu aan voor de 'Youth Tech Fest where Girls innovate' dagje bij CODAM - Coding College Amsterdam. In een programma op 9 maart 2019, van maximaal 5 uren zul je op een leuke en interactieve manier leren innoveren.

Locatie is in Amsterdam, bij CODAM de beste coding school ter wereld, op het Marineterrein. Je krijgt na afloop het boekje The New Girl Code cadeau mee. Ben je een meisje tussen de 11 en 18 jaar? Meld je aan en nodig je vriendinnetjes uit. Wees er snel bij, er is plek voor 35 meisjes. Jongens zijn natuurlijk ook welkom, want we staan voor diversiteit en inclusie.

title: Microbenchmarking: measuring and improving R code performance
description:
Welcome!

We are so thrilled to have Semiramis Castro as our speaker in our last event of the year. In this session we will discuss the core concepts about Microbenchmarking - that is, how to measure and improve performance of R code. We will base this session on chapter 23 and 24 of the Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/) by Hadley Wickham.

About R-Ladies NL book club
----------------------
This is the grand finale of a series of events based on Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book, hosted by R-Ladies chapters of the Netherlands.

You can find the slides and materials from previous sessions at: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

About Semiramis
----------------------
Semiramis is a software developer/data scientist who codes mainly in R and Python. She's a recent PhD graduate from the National Autonomous University of Mexico with a focus on genomics of pathogenic bacteria and antibiotic resistance. Among the bacteria she studied are the emerging pathogen Acinetobacter haemolyticus and the deadly Acinetobacter baumannii.

Event link
----------------------
We host our events in Jitsi (Note that Jitsi works best with chrome)

Link: https://meet.jit.si/rladies_bookclub_performance

Code of Conduct
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: Quasiquotation: Learning about the bang bang and curly curly slang
description:
Welcome!

In our next session Paloma Rojas-Saunero will share the key points on quasiquotation and useful tools from the rlang package. We will also learn about curly-curly, a new operator to make it easier to create functions around #tidyverse pipelines.

After that, we'll try some exercises together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles related to it.

About R-Ladies book club
----------------------
This session is part of the initiative by R-Ladies chapters of the Netherlands who have been hosting a series of events based on Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).

You can find the slides and materials from previous sessions and our agenda at: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

Also feel free to sign up to discuss one of the chapters there!

About "Quasiquotation" (Chapter 19, Advanced R)
----------------------
The package rlang has tools that you can use to capture (quote) unevaluated function arguments. You’ll also learn about quasiquotation, which provides a set of techniques to unquote input to make it possible to easily generate new trees from code fragments.

Event link
----------------------
We host our events in Jitsi (Note that Jitsi works best with chrome)

https://meet.jit.si/rladies_bangbang

Code of Conduct
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: Mastering R6! Advanced R, Chapter 14, R-Ladies NL Book Club
description:
Welcome!!

The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up and are hosting an online book club. As a first book, we chose to read and discuss Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).
Join us for our next meeting, in which Johanna Muñoz
will present the key points of Chapter 14: "R6".
After that, we'll try some exercises together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :)

You can find the full schedule and more information here: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

And sign up to discuss one of the chapters at https://bit.ly/2QBYGEG!

ABOUT Johanna
----------------------
Johanna is a researcher with a diverse background. She loves statistics, and although she considers she is far away from being a programming wizard, she survives using R as her weapon of choice.

ABOUT the chapter
----------------------
R6 is an implemention of encapsulated object-oriented programming for R, and is a simpler, faster, lighter-weight alternative to R’s built-in reference classes. This style of programming is also sometimes referred to as classical object-oriented programming.

Some features of R6 from https://r6.r-lib.org/:

- R6 objects have reference semantics.
- R6 cleanly supports inheritance across packages.
- R6 classes have public and private members.

REQUIREMENTS
----------------------
Make sure to read the chapter in advance!
Note that Jitsi works best with chrome

LINK TO MEETUP
----------------------
https://meet.jit.si/rladiesnl_bookclub_chp14

CODE OF CONDUCT
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: Mastering conditions! R Ladies NL Book Club - Advanced R Chapter 8
description:
Hi everyone,

The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up and are hosting an online book club. As a first book, we chose to read and discuss Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).
Join us for our next meeting, in which Semiramis Castro will present the key points of Chapter 8: "Conditions". After that, we'll try some exercises together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :)

You can find the full schedule and more information here: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

And sign up to discuss one of the chapters at https://bit.ly/2QBYGEG!

ABOUT Semiramis
----------------------
Semiramis is a software developer/data scientist who codes mainly in R and Python. She's a recent PhD graduate from the National Autonomous University of Mexico with a focus on genomics of pathogenic bacteria and antibiotic resistance. Among the bacteria she studied are the emerging pathogen Acinetobacter haemolyticus and the deadly Acinetobacter baumannii.

ABOUT the chapter
----------------------
“Conditions” is the umbrella term used to describe errors, warnings, and messages. You’ve certainly encountered these before, so in this chapter you learn how to signal them appropriately in your own functions, and how to handle them when signalled elsewhere.

REQUIREMENTS
----------------------
Make sure to read the chapter in advance!
Note that Jitsi works best with chrome

LINK TO MEETUP
----------------------
https://meet.jit.si/rladiesnl_bookclub_chp8

CODE OF CONDUCT
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: R Ladies Netherlands Book Club - Advanced R Chapter 3
description:
The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up!

Starting in April, we started hosting an online book club. Our first book is Hadley Wickham's Advanced R (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).

In our second meeting, Paloma Rojas-Saunero from R Ladies Rotterdam will present the key points of Chapter 3: "Vectors". After that, we'll go through the exercises together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :) Make sure to read the chapter in advance!

The link to the event meeting will be provided closer to the date.

Online meetings will take place every two weeks. Check the full schedule, previous slides and sign up to present a chapter at this link!

https://rladiesnl.github.io/book_club/

See you soon and stay safe!
